snippet: The run on sales of infant formula in Australia is being blamed on Chinese visitors who are believed to be buying in bulk and carrying it home any way they can manage.
abstract: Surge in sales of popular brand of baby formula in Australia, leading to empty shelves in some cases, is being blamed on Chinese visitors who, concerned about food quality at home, are believed to be buying in bulk and carrying it away; run is one of odder examples of how China’s thirst for high-quality products can upend faraway consumer markets.

byline.contributor: Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The run on sales of infant formula in Australia is being blamed on Chinese visitors who are believed to be buying in bulk and carrying it home any way they can manage.

headline.seo: Chinese Thirst for Safe Baby Formula Empties Australian Shelves
headline.main: Chinese Safety Concern Empties Distant Shelves
headline.print_headline: Chinese Safety Concern Empties Distant Shelves
